content: welcome to the dia de los muertos mini-cal a crochet-a-long which will take place over four weeks of time in which we create a stunning mandala/doily with as inspiration the dia de los muertos the traditional mexican holiday where we celebrate life and honor our passed ones and guide them to a good place in the afterlife my design is just made from a inspiration and artistic view to this mexican holiday this means i do not own any titles names or mexican heritage and is made from a outsiders point of view on this holiday saying this the cal will be a free one at all times to also make sure no provids are gained over this cultural event but as with every cal there are some important things to know before we start so here is all the information you need - the cal is free and will also stay free afterwards - **materials needed ** for this pattern you will need the basic materials like scissors a sewing needle and stitch markers some materials for blocking at the end of the cal are also useful as the pattern really needs to be blocked once finished in the pattern you will use two sizes crochet hooks as i used scheepjes catona for this pattern i used a 2 0mm hooksize and a 3 0mm hooksize we will refer to these as the smaller and bigger size hook in the patterns but if you decide to take another type or weight of yarn decide which size hook you will crochet the yarn with this will be your biggest size hook but for the skulls we need a smaller size hook and always take a full size down for the smallest hook so when you decide to take dk yarntype with crochet hook size 4 0mm take a 3 0mm hooksize for the smaller one please take this information serious otherwise the skulls won t fit into your pattern once applied - **yarn needed ** for this pattern i used scheepjes catona in eight different colors you can find the amounts and color numbers used in the introduction pdf files which you can already download out of this pattern page- or see my website for all yarn related information on my website are also online shops named which sells this yarn or even have made kits for this cal - **size ** the finished size of the project will have a diameter of 65 cm / 25 5 inches - **timeline ** from august 28th 2020 the introduction guide to this pattern will be available this introduction guide will hold all the information you need before and during this cal such as stitch use skill level pattern notes amount and yarn colors and a test skull to crochet make sure to download this file before you start as it also contains the abbreviations used in the patterns later on this also means for now this is the only file there
